title: Google\Cloud\Vision\Image
name: Image
description:
Represents an image to be annotated using Google Cloud Vision.

Please review Pricing before use, as a separate charge is incurred for each feature performed on an image. When practical, caching of results is certainly recommended.

The Cloud Vision API supports a variety of image file formats, including JPEG, PNG8, PNG24, Animated GIF (first frame only), and RAW.

Cloud Vision sets upper limits on file size as well as on the total combined size of all images in a request. Reducing your file size can significantly improve throughput; however, be careful not to reduce image quality in the process. See Best Practices - Image Sizing for current file size limits.

examples.caption: Image data can be given as a string
Files stored in Google Cloud Storage can be used.
This example sets a maximum results limit on one feature and provides some image context.
The client library also offers shortcut names which can be used in place of the longer feature names.
examples.code:
use Google\Cloud\Vision\Image;

$imageResource = fopen(__DIR__ . '/assets/family-photo.jpg', 'r');
$image = new Image($imageResource, [
    'faces',          // Corresponds to `FACE_DETECTION`
    'landmarks',      // Corresponds to `LANDMARK_DETECTION`
    'logos',          // Corresponds to `LOGO_DETECTION`
    'labels',         // Corresponds to `LABEL_DETECTION`
    'text',           // Corresponds to `TEXT_DETECTION`,
    'document',       // Corresponds to `DOCUMENT_TEXT_DETECTION`
    'safeSearch',     // Corresponds to `SAFE_SEARCH_DETECTION`
    'imageProperties',// Corresponds to `IMAGE_PROPERTIES`
    'crop',           // Corresponds to `CROP_HINTS`
    'web'             // Corresponds to `WEB_DETECTION`
]);

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Create an image with all required configuration.

params.name: image
params.description: An image to configure with the given settings. This parameter will accept a resource, a string of bytes, the URI of an image in a publicly-accessible web location, or an instance of Google\Cloud\Storage\StorageObject.

params.name: features
params.description: A list of cloud vision features to apply to the image. Google Cloud Platform Client Library provides a set of abbreviated names which can be used in the interest of brevity in place of the names offered by the cloud vision service. These names are faces, landmarks, logos, labels, text, document, safeSearch, imageProperties, crop, and web.

params.name: options.maxResults
params.description: A list of features and the maximum number of results to return. Keys should correspond to feature names given in the $features array, and values should be of type int. In all cases where $maxResults does not contain a value for a feature, all results will be returned. In cases where a $maxResults value is specified, the cloud vision service will return results up to the $maxResults value, or the full results, whichever is fewer.

methods.name: requestObject
methods.description:
Return a formatted annotate image request.

This method is used internally by Google\Cloud\Vision\VisionClient and is not generally intended for use outside of that context.

params.name: encode
params.description: If set to true, image bytes will be base64-encoded (required for json/rest requests)
